content: Is it possible to back up and rename a branch that already has a slew of new messages? Or would that require manually renaming each post? (If we did that, would it become a new thread, or just a bunch of posts with coincidentally the same subject?

Is it possible to back up and rename a branch that already has a slew of new messages? Or would that require manually renaming each post? (If we did that, would it become a new thread, or just a bunch of posts with coincidentally the same subject?
Admins can do that - though I don't know how far back we can go. When renaming a post, we can either rename a single post or all following. What do you need fixed?

It's in the "HIMSS definition of interop" thread, but I'm not asking for anything now - just wondering about the drift to:

  • HL7 definition of interop"
  • Can legit interop include a required proprietary component?

Again, no action required right now - I just try to be a good boy re thread hygiene, and I realized I had the question.
